title: 17th March

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let's generalise the sum . The sum is in a form of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle\sum_{n=1}^∞ \dfrac{\sin(nθ)}{n^3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Generally ,"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle\sum_{n=1}^∞ \dfrac{\sin(n\theta)}{n} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= \dfrac{1}{2i} \sum_{n=1}^∞ \dfrac{e^{i n\theta}-e^{-i n\theta}}{n}= -\dfrac{1}{2i}(\log(1-e^{i\theta})-\log(1-e^{-i\theta}))"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= \dfrac{1}{2i} \log(-e^{-i\theta})= \dfrac{\log(e^{iπ})-\log(e^{i\theta})}{2i} = \dfrac{π-\theta}{2} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Now integrate both sides from "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum_{n=1}^∞ \int_0^{\theta} \dfrac{\sin(n\theta)}{n} d\theta= \int_0^{\theta} \dfrac{π-\theta}{2}d\theta "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum_{n=1}^∞ \dfrac{\cos(n\theta)}{n^2} = \dfrac{\theta^2}{4}-\dfrac{π\theta}{2} +\sum_{n=1}^∞ \dfrac{1}{n^2} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Same process again you will get 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum_{n=1}^∞ \dfrac{\sin(n\theta)}{n^3} = \dfrac{\theta^3}{12} -\dfrac{π\theta^2}{4} +\theta\sum_{n=1}^∞ \dfrac{1}{n^2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= \dfrac{\theta^3}{12} -\dfrac{π\theta^2}{4} +\dfrac{π^2\theta}{6} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Put "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=\sqrt{2} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
You will get"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{\sin(\sqrt{2})}{1^3} +\dfrac{\sin(2\sqrt{2})}{2^3} +\dfrac{\sin(3\sqrt{2})}{3^3} +\cdots= \dfrac{1}{3\sqrt{2}}+\dfrac{π^2}{3\sqrt{2}}-\dfrac{π}{2} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" 
Answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{2b+a=7}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
